info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 8:52PM MDT until July 29 at 11:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central New Mexico, including the following county, southeastern Catron.
* WHEN...Until 1145 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 852 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen south of Old Horse Springs and across the Buck Fire burn scar. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaverhead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Runoff from rainfall could cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Buck Fire burn scar.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MDT THIS EVENING
